intro: Sphalmium racemosum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sphalmium racemosum is native to parts of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
